title: About me
desc: I'm Mike, a PhD student at Herts Uni. I'm interested in applying deep learning to cross-disciplinary problems in astrophysics, earth observation, medical imaging, and other fields.

title: Neuralnet-MCG
desc: A convolutional neural net (CNN) can successfully diagnose heart attack symptoms in ECG scans. A 3D CNN can also successfully diagnose heart attacks in a magnetocardiogram (MCG) video.  We correctly find that the ST section of an ECG/MCG is the most diagnostic part for detecting myocardial infarctions!

title: Heart-CNN
desc: A 3D siamese CNN finds dead cells in heart tomography scans.

title: SAGAN
desc: A spatial generative adversarial network model can generate synthetic astronomical 'observations' that are statistically indistinguishable from the real thing. We can use the same model to generate ridiculous amounts of data, like a 7.8 billion pixel synthetic observation.

title: Pix2Prof
desc: Language models can be applied to astronomy! A ResNet-18 => Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) encoder--decoder model is used to accurately 'caption' galaxy images with light profile data.

title: AstroDDPM
desc: A denoising diffusion probabilistic model can synthesise galaxies that are qualitatively and physically indistinguishable from the real thing. They can also remove satellite trails, and 'galaxify' images. Click here to cycle through some fake galaxies.
